params.lpTokens: Amount of LP tokens to burn.
params.tokenA: Address of the first token to receive.
params.tokenB: Address of the second token to receive.

returns.lpToken: Address of the LP token contract.

returns.balance: Amount of LP tokens staked by `account`.

returns.rewards: Total rewards harvested, returned in the base asset of the strategy (e.g. S).

params.minLpOut: Minimum LP tokens expected to prevent slippage.
params.pool: Identifier of the pool (e.g. pair address or ID).

params.gauge: Gauge address associated with the pool.
params.lpTokens: Amount of LP tokens to stake.
Amount of LP tokens to unstake.

exitPool(address,uint256,address,address.notice: Remove liquidity from a Shadow pool by burning LP tokens. The adapter handles all the complex range settlement stuff

getPoolApr(address).notice: Get the yield percentage for a pool (not including borrow costs). This lets strategies tell vaults what kind of returns to expect

getPoolGauge(address).notice: Get the gauge contract for a pool

getPoolLpToken(address).notice: Get the LP token contract for a pool. Useful for checking approvals

getStakedBalance(address,address).notice: Check how many LP tokens an account has staked in the gauge

harvestRewards(address).notice: Collect rewards from the gauge and convert them to base asset. Shadow rewards are usually SHADOW tokens or other incentive tokens. The adapter handles collection and conversion automatically

joinPool(address,address,address,uint256.notice: Add liquidity to a Shadow pool with two tokens. Make sure to approve this adapter to spend your tokens first. Shadow uses concentrated liquidity ranges - the adapter handles picking the right range for you

stakeInGauge(address,uint256).notice: Stake LP tokens in Shadow's gauge to earn extra rewards. The gauge is usually a separate contract that manages rewards

unstakeFromGauge(address,uint256).notice: Remove LP tokens from the Shadow gauge
